content: Yesterday, due to a dumb regrettable decision, I caused for myself a loss of $100. I was seeking a credit card urgently to pay my university fees in time, specifically their payment system is only compatible with credit cards. So for me being a crypto user, my assets are mainly in crypto. My only known option was the Binance marketplace [1].The first service on the marketplace is the All-in-one Card [2], Which offering a credit card loadable with Binance USDT through instant deposits. The issue appeared after depositing $100 and attempting to obtain the card, I discovered late that their service was temporarily disabled. Plus their live chat support is not availableFollowing this situation, I tried to withdrew the funds back to my Binance account [3]. It has been approximately 24 hours without any updates, So I really believe that my money may be lost and I have been scammed by a service that Binance are allowing and promoting.   Stay away from these services! [1]             [2][3]

comments.author: albon
comments.body: I genuinely hope they respond to you as soon as possible via email and refund the funds you deposited. Unfortunately, I couldn't find their links on social media and even contacting them through the form on their official website doesn't work. As you mentioned, live support has only been active for the past 5 days, and I couldn't find any previous feedback or reviews about these Global Finance cards, as if the service is neglected without any customers. If the service has indeed been disabled, why hasn't Binance removed it from their platform yet? I hope you provide an update regarding this issue within 48 hours. What I truly see is that these third-party services are not trustworthy. Thank you for alerting the community about what happened to you so they can research before using any of these services. Just because a service is on Binance doesn't mean it's legitimate. All Binance seems to do is disclaim responsibility without considering the impact on their customers.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: It is not a scam and any negative amount in the database means that it is a debt to the platform and they need more time to return the money to you. Therefore, the Binance platform owes you $99, and you must contact the support team to find out how to recover the money. Often the data returns automatically after a day, week or month, but waiting for the support team’s response will be best.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: I had to see what was going on so I went to install binance on my spare phone and uhhh... things ain't lookin' good.From what I understand, binance is only some sort of aggregator and since you've already used this particular service, I'm assuming you have already agreed to its TOS.Another thing I noticed was the service in question was marked as "new" -- not saying everything new is a scam but highlighting that newer services tends to be more risky compared to established ones.Whatever the case, try to get in touch with binance through their live support. They need to know what happened to you and perhaps eventually remove the service. You could post in r/binance as well for extra exposure.

comments.author: GxSTxV
comments.body: I finally received my 100$ withdrawalAfter several attempts trying to contact this All-in-one service support, I couldn’t reach out to the Live Support of that service which was unresponsive and off for days [1]. And with the help of @albon I sent them and email since their ticket service on their website [2] was also broken , I eventually contacted Binance support on live chat. Following my conversation with Binance Live Support the next day the withdrawal was successfully credited back to my account. However I really don't recommend using these services even they refunded my money and that’s due to various reasons, beside my personal experience and the lack of verification from Binance in case of scams. Binance's live chat support in my opinion lacks professionalism, because  I encountered late and difficulty communicating with them as you can see in the screenshots.[1]: [2]: https://glob.finance//
